header: Misc. Appln. No.168/2019. Parikshit Vaman Kulkarni etc. Vs. State.

background.text: ORDER BELOW EXH.1 (Passed on this 10th day of January 2019) Read application. Heard learned Advocate Shri.Taware for the applicants. Gone through the record and documents placed on record.

arguments.text: 2] It is the case of the applicant that they are apprehending their arrest by Loni Kalbhor police station, Pune. There is a matrimonial dispute between applicant No.1 and his wife Devkanya Maruti Shinge. Hence, the applicants are apprehending arrest on the complaint by Devkanya Shinge.

argumentSentences.text: 2] It is the case of the applicant that they are apprehending their arrest by Loni Kalbhor police station, Pune.
There is a matrimonial dispute between applicant No.1 and his wife Devkanya Maruti Shinge.
Hence, the applicants are apprehending arrest on the complaint by Devkanya Shinge.

arguments.text: 3] Admittedly, there is no complaint registered against the applicants. There is matrimonial dispute between the applicant No.1 and his wife. No offence is registered against the applicants. Therefore, question of apprehension does not arise. No prima facie case is made out. It appears that the applicants are apprehending their arrest under section 498-A read with section 34 of I.P.C. In the circumstances, no prima facie case is made out. However, it will be just and proper to give directions to the police authority to issue notice to the applicants after lodging of the offence against them. Hence, I proceed to pass the following order :-

argumentSentences.text: 3] Admittedly, there is no complaint registered against the applicants.
There is matrimonial dispute between the applicant No.1 and his wife.
No offence is registered against the applicants.
Therefore, question of apprehension does not arise.
No prima facie case is made out.
It appears that the applicants are apprehending their arrest under section 498-A read with section 34 of I.P.C.
In the circumstances, no prima facie case is made out.
However, it will be just and proper to give directions to the police authority to issue notice to the applicants after lodging of the offence against them.
Hence, I proceed to pass the following order :-

order.text: order 1) Application (Exh.1) is hereby allowed. 2) P.S.O. of Loni Kalbhor police station, Pune, is directed to issue 72 hours' notice to the applicants in case offence is registered against them. 3) In view of the above order, application is disposed of.

footer: (Mrs. Madhuri M. Deshpande) Date: 10-1-2019. Additional Session Judge, Pune. I affirm that the contents of this PDF file order are same word to word as per original order. Name of Steno : S.R. Shahane, Court Name : Mrs. Madhuri M. Deshpande Additional Sessions Judge, Pune. Date on which the P.O. Signed the order : 10-1-2019. Date of PDF file : 10-1-2019. Order uploaded on : 10-1-2019.
processedText:
Misc. Appln. No.168/2019. Parikshit Vaman Kulkarni etc. Vs. State. 
---header-ends---
ORDER BELOW EXH.1 (Passed on this 10th day of January 2019) Read application. Heard learned Advocate Shri.Taware for the applicants. Gone through the record and documents placed on record. 
---background-ends---
2] It is the case of the applicant that they are apprehending their arrest by Loni Kalbhor police station, Pune. There is a matrimonial dispute between applicant No.1 and his wife Devkanya Maruti Shinge. Hence, the applicants are apprehending arrest on the complaint by Devkanya Shinge. 
---argument-ends---
3] Admittedly, there is no complaint registered against the applicants. There is matrimonial dispute between the applicant No.1 and his wife. No offence is registered against the applicants. Therefore, question of apprehension does not arise. No prima facie case is made out. It appears that the applicants are apprehending their arrest under section 498-A read with section 34 of I.P.C. In the circumstances, no prima facie case is made out. However, it will be just and proper to give directions to the police authority to issue notice to the applicants after lodging of the offence against them. Hence, I proceed to pass the following order :- 
---argument-ends---
order 1) Application (Exh.1) is hereby allowed. 2) P.S.O. of Loni Kalbhor police station, Pune, is directed to issue 72 hours' notice to the applicants in case offence is registered against them. 3) In view of the above order, application is disposed of. 
---order-ends---
(Mrs. Madhuri M. Deshpande) Date: 10-1-2019. Additional Session Judge, Pune. I affirm that the contents of this PDF file order are same word to word as per original order. Name of Steno : S.R. Shahane, Court Name : Mrs. Madhuri M. Deshpande Additional Sessions Judge, Pune. Date on which the P.O. Signed the order : 10-1-2019. Date of PDF file : 10-1-2019. Order uploaded on : 10-1-2019.
